content:
Technology is ahead of ethics, we explain in this week’s Babbage podcast

SEX IS how humans propagate. But developments in genetic engineering might change this one day. “We are, in the future, going to have sex for most of the wonderful reasons that we have sex now: for fun, for pair-bonding, to connect with other people, to give meaning to our lives. But increasingly we are going to do it less and less for procreation,” says Jamie Metzl, the author of a new book on genetics, “Hacking Darwin.” 

Mr Metzl was speaking on The Economist ’s Babbage podcast on technology and science. Today, during in vitro fertilisation, it is possible to screen embryos for genetic disorders. Tomorrow it may be feasible to look for—or even add—new traits. (An excerpt from Mr Metzl’s book is here .) The podcast raised questions of technology, ethics and society. 

Listen on:  Apple Podcasts | Spotify  | Google  |  Stitcher  |  TuneIn

Genomic technologies are going from research lab to commercial service quickly, notably in America, which has permissive regulations. Steven Hsu, the cofounder of Genomic Prediction, discusses how his company already screens for Down’s Syndrome and is planning to test for other disorders.

Yet this may just be the start. As more traits are detectable through genetic testing, parents may be able to choose among traits in their natural embryos. But some would go further, and tinker with DNA to produce certain traits.

Gulzaar Barn, a philosopher at King’s College, London, is uneasy with this. On the podcast, she argued that society should be cautious before accepting genetic enhancement as a good thing, since it undermines the idea that we are all equal despite our genetic or individual differences (be it looks or intelligence, and so on).

Less controversially, basic genomic technologies are used to cure disease. Eric Topol is a doctor and author of several books on technology and health care (including “Deep Medicine,” recently reviewed in The Economis t). He looks forward to using genomics to tailor therapies around individual needs. “Instead of this kind of dumbed-down approach, where we treat people without knowing much more about them, we will have a far greater handle at many levels,” he tells us.

After talking to scientists, businesspeople, philosophers and doctors, the Babbage programme turned to the world of the arts and culture for the final word. We spoke to Ella Road, the 27-year-old playwright of “The Phlebotomist” (ie, someone who takes blood for medical testing). It recently concluded a run in London. 

In the play, people are rated for their genetic makeup. She argues on the podcast that her futuristic play isn’t far from the world of today, where people are rated on social media all the time and society accepts wide inequalities. You can read a scene from the play here .

This episode of Babbage was produced as part of The Economist ’s Open Future initiative, which makes the case for freedom, rights, technology and diversity in the 21st century. You can read more on the topics at Economist.com/openfuture .

And if you enjoy the Babbage podcast, please subscribe to the show or rate us ( here ) and share it on social media.

stated that the species originate by descent.

经前综合征
This syndrome is associated with frequent coughing.
这种综合症与经常咳嗽有关。
With teenagers, be prepared for the ‘Me, me, me!’ syndrome(= they think of themselves first) .
跟青少年在一起，对他们那种凡事只想到“我、我、我！”的典型心理不要大惊小怪。

ex: adj. 谨慎的；十分小心的
eg2: I have to be very cautious in what I say about abortion.
这位候选人说：我在讲人工流产的问题上必须十分谨慎。
He was even more  than ever, and did his utmost to win the trust and favour of the superior.
他更加谨小慎微， 兢兢业业， 以尽力取信讨好其上司。
You should be cautious of these distractions, but allow yourself the occasional distraction to break up your day.
对于这些让人分心的事物你应该谨慎，但是你也要允许自己偶尔的分心去分解你的一天。

ex: n. 多样性；差异
eg2: Thus, they have few clues as to why this diversity exists.
这样，他们对于这多样性存在的线索知道很少。
A world of peace and solidarity can only be accomplished by acknowledging and celebrating our .
只有承认和颂扬我们的多样性，才能实现一个和平与团结的世界。
They help us grasp the diversity of life on the planet.
这些标本有助于我们把握地球生命的多样性。

ex: adj. 哑的，无说话能力的；不说话的，无声音的

eg2: He has been dumb from birth.
他生来就哑。
These are all dumb reason to invest – of course. But it happens.
这些当然都是些愚蠢的投资原因。但是确实是这样。
But the Japanese viewer is insulated because this is the story of only one woman and a rather  one at that.
但是日本的观众没有受什么影响，因为这仅仅是一个女人的故事，而且还是一个相当愚蠢的女人。

The idea already existed in embryo in his earlier novels.

“In each nation, she will emphasize Africa as a place of opportunity, built on the  of responsibility,” Kelly said.
凯利说：“她将在到访每个国家时强调非洲是建立在道德责任基础上的机会之地。
In The Castle that surrender to the everyday becomes an .
《城堡》，屈服于每日的生活成了一种道德准则。

ex: n. 摘录，引用

eg2: This next excerpt details the last case of smallpox, which was discovered in Somalia.
摘录下一个详细资料是在索马里发现的最后一个天花病例。
The excerpt below includes only portions of code that have changed from the previous example.
下面这个摘录只包含从前一个例子发生了改变的部分代码。
“Because there is a law such as gravity, the Universe can and will create itself from nothing, ” the  says.
“因为存在一个物理定律，即万有引力，使得宇宙可以从无到有将自己创造出来的，”摘录提到。

这计划似属可行。

wp.Genetic Structure: 遗传结构;基因结构;遗传构造
wp.genetic mutation: 基因突变;基因渐变;遗传突变;基因图谱
wp.genetic disorder: 遗传性疾病;遗传病;遗传性障碍;遗传缺陷
wp.genetic algorithms: 遗传算法;遗传演算法;柔性分析模型;基因演算法

ex: adj. 遗传的；基因的；起源的
eg2: So what is the genetic algorithm?
那么什么是遗传算法呢？
The extent to which genes are to blame varies, but for those with the worst vision, around 80% of the condition is caused by genetic factors.
在多大程度上归咎于基因并不一定，但是对于那些视力最差的人来说，80%的情况下是由遗传因子导致的。
One biologist developed a formula for how much genetic material would have to be to saved in the act of altruism for it to be worthwhile.
一位生物学家发展了一套公式，用来计算到底有多少遗传物质可以被保留下来的时候，利他的行为才是值得的。

wp.clausius inequality: 克劳修斯不等式;克劳休斯不等式
wp.absolute inequality: 绝不等式;绝对不均等线;		绝对不等式;毫不等式
wp.social inequality: 社会不平等;社会不公;不平等;社会差等
wp.Chebyshev inequality: 比雪夫不等式;切比雪夫不等式;不等式;契比雪夫不等式

ex: n. 不平等；不同；不平均
eg2: If inequality were the problem, people would be less upset today than they were in 2007.
如果不平等是问题所在， 2007年的时候人们应该比今天更加愤怒。
Where I once saw only poverty, I learned to see systemic inequality and the possibility of change.
当我只看见贫困的时候，我也学着去发现体系的不平等和改变的可能性。

wp.Improved Initiative: 精通先攻;优先改善;强化先攻;改善优先权
wp.Energy Initiative: 能源倡议;能源计划;能源研究计划;研究小组
wp.Sunshot Initiative: 太阳计划;新能源计划;升夏倡议;射日计划
wp.Take initiative: 积极主动;主动性;工作主动

ex: n. 主动权；首创精神；新方案；倡议
adj. 主动的；自发的；起始的
eg2: I put it all down to his hard work and .
我把这一切归因于他工作既勤奋又主动。
He showed little , handling all matters strictly by the book.
他缺乏首创精神，墨守成规地办一切事情。
These are the resources that we need to seize the , while building the Afghan capacity that can allow for a responsible transition of our forces out of Afghanistan.
这是我们为了掌握主动权所必需的资源，同时阿富汗的能力将得到加强，使我们的部队能够以负责任的方式离开阿富汗。

ex: n. 化妆品；组成；性格；体格
网络 粉底；最佳化妆；彩妆
adv. 显著地；尤其
eg2: But the gathering of so many political heavyweights in one place can only be of concern to those not there, and  President Bashir and his party.
但是，如此众多的政治重量级人物齐聚同一地点，对那些未参加的人来说造成隐患，尤其是总统巴希尔和他的全国大会党。

ex: adj. 许可的；自由的；宽容的；（两性关系）放纵的
eg2: If you build a new project based on this code, do you distribute it under permissive terms as well?
如果您基于此代码构建了一个新的项目，那么您也要在相同的许可条款下发布该项目么？
But the culture evolved to be less restrictive and more  – the idea of open source licences that permit but don't require new contributions, additions to be made available to everybody.
卡普尔说，“但是这种文化变得更少限制、更宽容——开源软件许可的理念意味允许但并不要求做出新的贡献，并且人人都可以得到新增部分。”
Some react to an exceedingly strict household by becoming permissive parents, but not Chua.
有些人在极为严格的家庭教育之后变成了宽容的家长，但蔡没有。

ex: n. 哲学家；深思的人；善于思考的人
网络 哲人；思想家；学者
eg2: the Greek philosopher Aristotle
希腊哲学家亚里士多德
He seems to be a bit of a philosopher.
他像个思想家似的。

ex: n. 剧作家；编剧
网络 编剧家；戏剧家；戏剧作家
n. 生殖；生产
vt. 传播；传送；繁殖；宣传
vi. 繁殖；增殖
eg2: Most plants propagate by seed.
大多数植物靠种子繁殖。
You need to  the edits over each new version.
您需要将编辑的内容传播到每个新版本中。
Animal and vegetable pests propagate with extreme rapidity.
动植物病害传播极快。

ex: vi. 订阅；捐款；认购；赞成；签署
vt. 签署；赞成；捐助
eg2: You can subscribe here for your newspapers.
你可以在这儿订阅你要的那几份报纸。
If a component wishes to receive a notification every time a particular topic is published, it should  with the broker.
如果一个组件希望在每次有一个特定的主题发布时接收通知消息，它应该向代理程序订阅。
Please read on, stay posted, , and we welcome you to tell us what you think.
请阅读下去、继续掌握我们的动态、订阅，也欢迎您向我们提出意见。

ex: v. 专门制作；定做
n. （尤指为顾客个别定制男装的）裁缝
网络 裁缝师；缝制；剪裁
eg2: Special programmes of study are tailored to the needs of specific groups.
为满足特定群体的需要，特制了专门的课程。
Most travel agents are prepared to tailor travel arrangements to meet individual requirements.
为了满足个别人士需要，大多数旅行社都愿意作出专门的旅游安排。

wp.Horticultural therapy: 园艺疗法;园艺治疗;园艺治療
wp.reality therapy: 现实治疗法;现实疗法;现实治疗;年出版
wp.shock therapy: 休克疗法;震荡疗法;冲击疗法;震击治疗法
wp.targeted therapy: 靶向治疗;标靶治疗;靶向疗治;标靶疗法
wp.Radiation therapy: 放射线疗法;放射治疗;		放射疗法;		辐射疗法
wp.Art Therapy: 艺术治疗;艺术疗法;美术治疗法;艺术心理疗法
wp.Gestalt therapy: 格式塔治疗;完形治疗;格式塔疗法;完形治疗法

ex: n. 治疗，疗法
eg2: Have you ever had ?
你曾进行过某些疗法吗？
Apply the power of prayer therapy in your life.
在你的生活中运用祈祷治疗这种能力。
You can do [some of that] in therapy but it's so powerful when you do it in a relationship.
你可以在治疗中去进行（这样的改变），但是当你在一段关系中这样做时，它很强大。

wp.John Tinker: 师约翰廷克;分析师约翰辛克尔;汀克;析师约翰
wp.MARK TINKER: 总监马霆亨;经理丁克;主管马克;丁克尔
wp.Tinker AFB: 廷克空军基地;克尔空军基地

ex: n. 补锅匠；修补匠；焊锅；（美）小鲭鱼
vi. 做焊锅匠；焊补；笨手笨脚地做事
vt. 修补；粗修
n. (Tinker)人名；(英)廷克
eg2: If we begin to tinker with that and don’t know what we are doing, we are likely to mess up and cause side effects that might only become evident much later.
如果我们开始修补这个系统，却不知道在做什么，那就肯定会弄得一团糟，并且可能很久之后才会发现所引起的副作用。
It's not perfect, but like many instances of technological development, we tinker at it and it changes and eventually we come to a point where we like it or keep changing.
这并不完美，但是就像许多技术发展的实例，我们在对其进行修补并得到了改善，最终我们会达到我们满意的程度，若没有我们还会继续改进。
The assumption in here" – he nods impatiently towards the House of Commons – "is that we tinker with this economic system, and then go back to 60 consecutive quarters of growth.
可能出现的情况是（他匆匆朝经过的下院议员们点了点头）我们随意地修补了这个经济系统，然后重回到持续了60个季度的经济增长。

ex: n. 特性，特点；品质；少许
n. (Trait)人名；(法)特雷

wp.Thalassemia trait: 地中海贫血特性;轻型β;轻度地中海型贫血;地中海型贫血
wp.Quantitative trait: 数量性状;数目性状;数量性状基因
wp.source trait: 本源特质;根源特质;源特质;潜源特质

eg2: That was her .
那是她的特点。
For every , you can interpret it in a positive and a negative manner.
对于每一个特点，你都能用积极和消极的态度来解释它。
Of all the possible reasons one might think or justify it’s down to the obtuse chains of a  I get from my Mother: hoarding (!).
在所有可能的原因中，有一个可以解释或有理由认为它已经成了迟钝的枷锁。 一钟源于我母亲的特点：囤积。

wp.undermine e: 暗中破坏;危害;破坏;侵蚀…的基础

ex: vt. 破坏，渐渐破坏；挖掘地基
eg2: His enemies are spreading rumours to undermine his authority.
他的敌人在散布谣言来暗中破坏他的威信。
That’s why I won’t accept any attempts to undermine the independence of this agency.
这就是为什么我不会容忍任何破坏这一机构的独立性的企图。
Neither side supports any attempts by any force to  this principle.
双方均不支持任何势力企图破坏这一原则的行动。

ex: n. 体外，试管内
n. (Vitro)人名；(西)比特罗；(意)维特罗

wp.in vitro: 体外;在体外;离体;体外培养

eg2: She hopes to tinker with her system to further enhance protein production in , and see if the system can be applied to enhance translation in live cells.
她希望能够改进这一系统来进一步增进试管内的蛋白质生产，并且进一步研究该系统能否被应用在细胞体内增进转化。
We have to do in- cell culture experiments first, prove it in an animal model, and then develop a molecule or protein which will affect the mutated gene product.
我们首先得做一个体外细胞培养实验，在动物模型中证明它的存在，然后开发出一种能影响突变基因产物的分子或蛋白质。
Used in conjunction with in  fertilization, this would eliminate the need for female XO/XX chimeras, although a surrogate mother would still be needed to carry the two-father pregnancy to term.
如果这项技术和试管繁殖结合，虽然怀着两个爸爸的孩子的代孕妈妈仍然是必须的，但雌性XO/XX杂合体这一中间过程必将被淘汰。

Title: The genomics revolution for good and ill

paperStatistics.title: The genomics revolution for good and ill
paperStatistics.desc: Technology is ahead of ethics, we explain in this week’s Babbage podcast
